author: KaylorDave
body:
Quite simply, I would love to see a build of PowerShell for Android.

A clear and concise description of what the problem is that the new feature would solve.
Try formulating it in user story style (if applicable):
As a user of PowerShell, I would like to be able to run it directly from my Android devices without having to use an external service such as Azure Cloud Shell. This would allow me to manage my infrastructure from anywhere easily without requiring any remoting into a dev machine or the use of 3rd party services like the aforementioned Cloud Shell.

comments.author: KaylorDave
comments.body: To add- I believe this fits into the model of 'manage anything, from anywhere' for PowerShell.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
@KaylorDave PowerShell Core is based on .Net Core and .Net Core should first be supported on Android https://github.com/dotnet/core/blob/master/release-notes/2.1/2.1-supported-os.md 
Please ask .Net Core team.

comments.author: hez2010
comments.body:
What about now? https://github.com/dotnet/core/blob/main/release-notes/6.0/supported-os.md#android Any chance to bring PowerShell to Android at .NET 6.0 time phase?
GitHub
dotnet/core
Home repository for .NET Core. Contribute to dotnet/core development by creating an account on GitHub.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: Please open new issue with right template.

title: Android build
